it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments

Class AbstractEnvironment<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.environments.AbstractEnvironment<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEnvironment<T>, Serializable, Iterable<INode<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractLinkingRuleEnvironment, DiscreteStaticGrid2DManhattan

    public abstract class AbstractEnvironment<T>
extends Object
implements IEnvironment<T>
    Very generic and basic implementation for an environment. Basically, only manages an internal set of nodes and their position.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getNodesWithinRange

        public List<INode<T>> getNodesWithinRange(INode<T> center,
                                          double range)
        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
        Given a node (center) this method returns a list of all the surroundings nodes within the given range. Note that this method (depending on the implementation) might be not optimized and it's consequently much better to use IEnvironment.getNeighborhood(INode) and filter the neighborhood if you are sure that all the nodes within the range are connected to the center.
        Specified by:
        getNodesWithinRange in interface IEnvironment<T>
        Parameters:
        center - the node to consider as center
        range - the exploration range
        Returns:
        the list of nodes within the range

      • getAllNodesInRange

      • getNodesWithinRange

        public List<INode<T>> getNodesWithinRange(IPosition center,
                                          double range)
        Description copied from interface: IEnvironment
        Given a IPosition(center) this method returns a list of all the surroundings nodes within the given range. Note that this method (depending on the implementation) might be not optimized.
        Specified by:
        getNodesWithinRange in interface IEnvironment<T>
        Parameters:
        center - the IPosition to consider as center
        range - the exploration range
        Returns:
        the list of nodes within the range

      • getPreferredMonitor

        public String getPreferredMonitor()
        Specified by:
        getPreferredMonitor in interface IEnvironment<T>
        Returns:
        the class name of the monitor that should preferably used for displaying the contents of this environment. Full class names are recommended: it's up to the graphical interface to decide how to deal with simple class names (whether or not to prefix a standard package). In case of null return or inexistent class, the default monitor will be used.
